file.title: AMM PART II-1285 - CHAPTER 23-14-01-04 - CONFIG-2 - V/UHF REMOTE CONTROL PANEL - REMOVAL/INSTALLATION

page.data: AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL V/UHF REMOTE CONTROL PANEL - REMOVAL/INSTALLATION EFFECTIVITY: AIRCRAFT WITH SINGLE V/UHF SYSTEM 1. General A. This section gives the procedures to remove and install the V/UHF Remote Control Panel. B. The procedures in this section are given in the sequence below. The tasks identified with ( ♦) are part of the Scheduled Maintenance Requirements Document (SMRD). TASK NUMBER DESCRIPTION EFFECTIVITY AIRCRAFT WITH SIN- V/UHF REMOTE CONTROL PANEL - RE- 23-14-01-000-801-A GLE V/UHF SYSTEM MOVAL AIRCRAFT WITH SIN- V/UHF REMOTE CONTROL PANEL - IN- 23-14-01-400-801-A GLE V/UHF SYSTEM STALLATION EMB-145 - AMM 1285 General CONFIG-2 23-14-01 Page 1 of 6 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 23-14-01-000-801-A EFFECTIVITY: AIRCRAFT WITH SINGLE V/UHF SYSTEM 2. V/UHF REMOTE CONTROL PANEL - REMOVAL A. General (1) This task gives the procedures to remove the V/UHF remote control panel. (2) There is one V/UHF remote control panel installed on the aircraft cockpit, on the control pedestal forward panel. B. Zones and Accesses ZONE PANEL/DOOR LOCATION 223 Control pedestal C. Tools and Equipment Not Applicable D. Auxiliary Items Not Applicable E. Consumable Materials Not Applicable F. Expandable Parts Not Applicable G. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE 1 Does the task Cockpit H. Preparation SUBTASK 841-004-A (1) Make sure that the aircraft is safe for maintenance. (2) On the circuit-breaker panel, open the V/UHF XCVR circuit breaker and attach a DO- NOT-CLOSE tag to it. I. Removal (Figure 401) SUBTASK 020-004-A (1) Loosen the Dzus fasteners (3) that attach the V/UHF remote control panel (1). (2) Carefully pull the V/UHF remote control panel (1) from the control pedestal forward panel to get access to the electrical connector (2). CAUTION: DO NOT TOUCH THE ELECTRICAL PINS OF THE CONNECTORS. DAMAGE CAN OCCUR TO THE INTERNAL COMPONENTS. (3) Disconnect the electrical connector (2). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 CONFIG-2 23-14-01 Page 2 of 6 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL (4) Remove the V/UHF remote control panel (1) from the control pedestal forward panel. (5) Install the correct ESD protective caps on the disconnected electrical connectors. EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 CONFIG-2 23-14-01 Page 3 of 6 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL EFFECTIVITY: AIRCRAFT WITH SINGLE V/UHF SYSTEM V/UHF Remote Control Panel - Removal/Installation Figure 401 A 1. V/UHF REMOTE 2. CONNECTOR CONTROL PANEL DET. A 3. DZUS FASTENER (4) EM145AMM231189A.DGN EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 CONFIG-2 23-14-01 Page 4 of 6 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 23-14-01-400-801-A EFFECTIVITY: AIRCRAFT WITH SINGLE V/UHF SYSTEM 3. V/UHF REMOTE CONTROL PANEL - INSTALLATION A. General (1) This task gives the procedures to install the V/UHF remote control panel. (2) There is one V/UHF remote control panel installed on the aircraft cockpit, on the control pedestal forward panel. B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION AMM TASK 23-14-00-700-801-A/500 - AMM TASK 23-14-00-800-801-A/200 - C. Zones and Accesses ZONE PANEL/DOOR LOCATION 223 Control pedestal D. Tools and Equipment Not Applicable E. Auxiliary Items Not Applicable F. Consumable Materials Not Applicable G. Expandable Parts Not Applicable H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE 1 Does the task Cockpit I. Installation (Figure 401) SUBTASK 420-004-A CAUTION: DO NOT TOUCH THE ELECTRICAL PINS OF THE CONNECTORS. DAMAGE CAN OCCUR TO THE INTERNAL COMPONENTS. (1) Remove the ESD protective caps from the disconnected electrical connectors. (2) Hold the V/UHF remote control panel (1) and connect the electrical connector (2). (3) Carefully put the V/UHF remote control panel (1) in position. EMB-145 - AMM 1285 400-801-A/400 CONFIG-2 23-14-01 Page 5 of 6 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL (4) Tighten the Dzus fasteners (3) that attach the V/UHF remote control panel (1) to the control pedestal forward panel. J. Follow-on SUBTASK 842-004-A (1) On the circuit-breaker panel, close the V/UHF XCVR circuit breaker and remove the DO-NOT-CLOSE tag from it. (2) NOTE: When the V/UHF remote-control panel is replaced with a new or repaired unit, it is necessary to reconfigure the V/UHF system (AMM TASK 23-14-00-800-801-A/200). Do the V/UHF functional test (AMM TASK 23-14-00-700-801-A/500). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 400-801-A/400 CONFIG-2 23-14-01 Page 6 of 6 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.
